data.title: Manipulating root files in the treeview collapses all directories
data.body:
1. Open some directories in tree view
2. Creating a new file or folder on the root path, or delete a root folder
3. All open directories collapse

Expected: everything stays open

![treeview](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/64050/831256/bf71c4c0-f1c3-11e2-8623-220eed8d6ce3.gif)

data.title: @mdo's wishlist
data.body:
@mdo, add to this as you see fit.
- [ ] Find and replace is confusing
  - No buttons to confirm what I'm doing
  - How do I replace?
  - How do I search a specific directory in a project?
- [ ] Click on line number to select that line
- [ ] Zen coding
- [x] Word wrap

data.title: grunt-lesslint dependency error
data.body:
@kevinsawicki So I saw that message again that we saw when @benogle and I we're setting up.

```
npm WARN unmet dependency /Users/mcolyer/github/atom/node_modules/grunt-lesslint requires less@'~1.4.0' but will load
npm WARN unmet dependency /Users/mcolyer/github/atom/node_modules/less,
npm WARN unmet dependency which is version 1.3.3
npm WARN unmet dependency /Users/mcolyer/github/atom/node_modules/grunt-lesslint requires async@'~0.2.9' but will load
npm WARN unmet dependency /Users/mcolyer/github/atom/node_modules/async,
npm WARN unmet dependency which is version 0.2.6
```

Upon digging in it appears that grunt-lesslint never worked with the version of async 0.2.6 (as it used 0.2.9 when added). So I'm guessing the thing to do here is to update async and less in atom (which will require rebasing nathan's forked less copy). 

Before doing that I wasn't sure if there was a specific reason that those two npms were locked at those versions and how you guys typically handled upgrading dependencies.

data.title: Small dark theme change
data.body: The text selection was less visible than the current line highlight. And when selecting, then unselecting text, the current line highlight would pop in and out making me think the current line was selected.

data.title: Add new commands for moving between words
data.body:
Moving between words with `editor:move-to-end-of-word` and `editor:move-to-beginning-of-word` confuse me. So I'm adding new commands that work more like sublime. They will be:
- [x] `editor:move-to-previous-word-boundary`
- [x] `editor:move-to-next-word-boundary`
- [x] `editor:select-to-previous-word-boundary`
- [x] `editor:select-to-next-word-boundary`

Basically, my issues are:
- Moving around wordwise messes with my expectations
  - expect it to stop at end of line
  - expect it to stop at begin of line
  - `(@somevar|, omg)` cursor at pipe, move word left x2, expect it to be `(|@somevar, omg)` but is `|(@somevar, omg)`
- Moving around wordwise should be consistent backward to forward
  Cursor is at pipe
  
  ```
    @scrollView.on 'scroll', =>|
      if @scrollLeft() == 0
  ```
  
  Then move right one word, it does this:
  
  ```
    @scrollView.on 'scroll', =>
      if| @scrollLeft() == 0
  ```
  
  I expect cursor to land at pipes when moving right from initial
  
  ```
    @scrollView.on 'scroll', =>|
  |  |if| @scrollLeft() == 0
  ```

data.title: Fix scrollbar css issues
data.body:
I whined about them in #640. 
- [x] the treeview resize handle covers the scrollbar
- [x] the scrollbar in the editor is covered up

data.title: Add editor:select-to-first-character-of-line command
data.body: There was a `editor:move-to-first-character-of-line` but no corresponding `editor:select-to-first-character-of-line` command. This adds the select command.

data.title: Changing themes doesn't update the interface
data.body: I talked with @probablycorey about this and he mentioned that the intended functionality is that when you change the theme, than the interface should update. Currently it requires you to reload the interface.

data.title: Create a user's package directory if missing
data.body:
This now makes sure that new users can install packages (as if the directory is missing, packages won't install).

@probablycorey @nathansobo feedback appreciated.

data.title: BenOgle's wishlist
data.body:
Using it and recording my knee jerk reactions. Adding to as I get deeper.
### Misaligned expectations

All these in #645 
- [x] Move to beginning of line, want it to stop at the indent and toggle between beginning and indent level.
- [x] Moving around wordwise messes with my expectations
  - expect it to stop at end of line
  - expect it to stop at begin of line
  - `(@somevar|, omg)` cursor at pipe, move word left x2, expect it to be `(|@somevar, omg)` but is `|(@somevar, omg)`
- [x] Moving around wordwise is not consistent backward to forward
  Cursor is at pipe
  
  ```
    @scrollView.on 'scroll', =>|
      if @scrollLeft() == 0
  ```
  
  Then move right one word, it does this:
  
  ```
    @scrollView.on 'scroll', =>
      if| @scrollLeft() == 0
  ```
  
  I expect cursor to land at pipes when moving right from initial
  
  ```
    @scrollView.on 'scroll', =>|
  |  |if| @scrollLeft() == 0
  ```
### Annoyances
- [x] the auto indent when I intend to make a new line on the previous indent level. Not sure what the right rule is #661 
  - if I am on a blank line, back one or more indent levels, I dont want it to indent when I hit enter
- [ ] autocomplete should come up when I type. now I have to push ctrl+space?
- [x] text selected, I push an arrow right or left key, I expect it to go to one side or the other of the selection, but not move.
- [ ] I'm up against some text and type an open paren, it should not close the paren.
- [x] Lots of things folded, unfold large item at indent 0 toward top of page. It scrolls to the cursor way down the page. #634 
- [x] Autoflow needs to be comment aware
- [x] SaveAs must choose the current file's dir. omg frustrating.
### WANT
- [x] bookmarks!! #655 
### Issues
- [x] the treeview resize handle covers the scrollbar #644 
- [x] the scrollbar in the editor is covered up #644
- [x] Open saveas. Let it hang for a while. save the file: up pops the not responding dialog. atom/atom-shell#42

data.body:
- [x] Fold comments when in `foldAll()`
- [x] Fold all at some indent level
- [x] Clean up fold code a bit
- [x] Think about where to put the tests: `LanguageMode` or `EditSession`?

data.title: Missing packages directory prevents package installation
data.body: Packages can not be installed if ~/.atom/packages doesn't exist.

data.title: No feedback when package fails to install
data.body:
When I try to install the current vim release, it fails but unfortunately it doesn't give any indication of that it failed or why.
1. Install atom version 17cecda.
2. Open preferences.
3. Click packages and install vim 0.1
4. Install switches to "Installing ..." and then back to "Install" and nothing appears to happen.

data.title: Preference window is too slow to open
data.body: From an interaction perspective It makes me question whether I clicked on the right menu item or whether I should do it again.

data.title: Add proper indents to comments on toggle-line-comments Closes #615
data.body:
``` coffeescript
class Something
  whatev: (items) ->
    while items.length > 0
      # current = items.shift()
      # if current < pivot
      #   left.push(current)
      # else
      #   right.push(current);
```

Rather than

``` coffeescript
class Something
  whatev: (items) ->
    while items.length > 0
#       current = items.shift()
#       if current < pivot
#         left.push(current)
#       else
#         right.push(current);
```

data.title: Scroll position jumps to cursor location after expanding a fold by clicking
data.body:
- 1) Create a fold at the top of a large file
- 2) Place the cursor at the bottom of the file
- 3) Scroll up with your mouse and click the fold to expand it
- :facepunch:) The view scrolls back down to the cursor's location

This is because the cursor's location on screen changed, triggering an autoscroll. I'm not quite sure what to do here... disable autoscroll for fold expansions?

data.title: autosave still prompts for save with cmd-r
data.body:
I have `'autosave': true` but still see this prompt when refreshing atom:

![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/2/815388/e6de9d4c-ef27-11e2-98f5-ca5a49b5cf20.png)

data.title: Can't right click > inspect element
data.body:
I'm attempting to make the hard switch to Atom, which has left me craving many things that don't exist yet. In trying to add things myself, I find myself falling into my web habits of right clicking on elements to choose "inspect element" except that isn't an option in Atom.

Toggling the dev tools on, then slowly expanding dom elements until I get to what I want to modify is slowly killing my soul. Is there a reason that we can't inspect via right click/can I make a formal feature request?

data.title: Delete or correct documentation comments
data.body: There are many cases where `### Internal ###` and `### Public ###` declarations are inaccurate or poorly organized. There are also method comments that contain inaccurate types / explanations. I would like to do a pass and ensure that comments are either accurate or delete them.

data.title: Command-N doesn't work
data.body: When no project is open I should still be able to press Command-N to get a new editor window. I built from master yesterday and there is no menu item for New window and Command-N doesn't do anything. Once a project is opened, Command-N works as expected (opening a new window with a blank document).

data.title: Text selection does not work in "sign in to github" fields
data.body: cmd-a, shift+arrows, etc

data.title: File Tree Collapses When New Files Detected
data.body:
I've always wondered why this happened, and I just figured it out. When a new file is added somewhere in the tree of the project you have open, the left side tree nav collapses.

I noticed while working on github/talks. In Talks, you upload slides to get processed. In the background its slowly but surely adding jpgs to `/public/uploads/tmp`.

This means my tree keeps closing while working. It's pretty awful.

data.title: Tree view border disappears at small sizes
data.body:
When I make the sidebar smaller than its content width, the right border disappears, presumably because it's a border on the sidebar which is cropped with `overflow: hidden;`

![screen shot 2013-07-09 at 11 02 54 am](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/72919/769946/e65d9380-e8c1-11e2-9f7a-51fd65b2af51.png)

data.title: Investigate atom-shell startup time
data.body: Currently we log the load time of the window but don't have any metrics about the startup time spent in `atom-application.coffee`, `main.coffee`, and `atom-window.coffee`.

data.title: Upgrade to latest octicons
data.body: The order has changed and so https://github.com/styleguide/css/7.0 isn't currently very helpful.
